result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin T. Pfaff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Justin T. Pfaff is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Justin T. Pfaff was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Justin T. Pfaff was found guilty of Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 16CM302 and 16CM807.  Credit for 2 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Gina S, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Comply with physician on any mental health treatment.

timeConds.notes: AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION court imposes 120 days KCJ with credit since the 12/13/16 order to detain.  No huber allowed for employment or treatment.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty James Allen.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  937 - Matter is resolved. DE enters plea of guilty to Cts 2, 4 - found guilty by the court. Cts 1, 3 dismissed outright. Sentence recommendations. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions for each count - cts to run concurrently and concurrent to 16CM302, 16CM807. 2 days sentence credit if revoked. Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Court costs ordered.  No restitution requested.  Appeal rights given. DE make seek expunction upon successful completion of probation.

State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells. DE appears in custody with Atty James Allen.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES: 348 - ST requests brief adjournment to allow for review of new charges - granted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.
NO RECORD MADE. Hearing rescheduled prior to court to allow DE to enroll in treatment.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

State of Wisconsin appears by Atty K. Richard Wells. DE appears in person with Atty James Allen.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  152 - Matter heard with 16CM302. Atty Allen reports DE has entered a voluntary counseling program - adjournment request to allow completion. Granted - bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on April 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State. DE appears in person. No appearance by Atty James Allen, who was just recently appointed.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1046 - Atty Allen can not be located for hearing. FPT rescheduled and NOH sent to all parties by clerk.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
